Description: Optional field to leave notes
Unique identfier for the analysis performed for a particular group of samples
Unique identifier for the control sample
Unique identifier for the variation
Functional consequence of the SNP.  If multiple transcripts are involved, separate multiple consequences by commas. (#)
Changes at amino acid level. Indicate the reference aa, position and variation aa.  If multiple transcripts are involved, separate multiple aa variation by commas.
Changes in coding sequence.  Indicate position, reference base and variation base.  If multiple transcripts are involved, separate multiple cds variation by commas.
Protein domain containing the mutation/variation.  Use Pfam accession.  If multiple transcripts are involved, separate multiple domains by commas.
Gene(s) containing the mutation/variation.  Use Ensembl gene id. Separate multiple genes with vertical bars in the form of geneA|geneB|geneC.  If no gene is affected, use -888 (not applicable).

Transcript(s) containing the mutation/variation.  Use Ensembl transcript id. Separate multiple transcripts from the same gene with commas, and separate transcripts from different genes with vertical bars. eg. transcriptA1, transcriptA2|transcriptB1|transcriptC1,transcriptC2,transcriptC3.  If no transcript is affected, use -888 (not applicable).
Version of Ensembl gene build used for annotation

For known exons, use exonID1_exonID2 where exonID1 and exonID2 are Ensembl IDs of the 5' and 3' exons, respectively.  For novel or putative exons, use assemblyBuild_exon1chr_exon1end_exon2chr_exon2start where assemblyBuild is hg18 or hg19; exon1chr and exone2chr are the chromosomes of the 5' and 3' exons, respectively; exon1end is the end position of the 5'exon; exon2start is the start position of the 3'exon.

Stable ID of the gene containing the 5' exon at the junction.  For annotated gene, use Ensembl gene ID.  For putative and novel gene, use assemblyBuild_chr_start_end where assemblyBuild can be hg18 or hg19.
Name of the chromosome containing the above gene.
Strand of the chromosome
Start position of the entire gene on the chromosome as annotated in Ensembl
End position of the entire gene on the chromosome as annotated in Ensembl

In the case of a fusion gene, provide the Stable ID of the gene containing the 3' exon at the junction.  For annotated genes, use Ensembl gene ID.  For putative and novel genes, use assemblyBuild_chr_start_end where assemblyBuild can be hg18 or hg19.
Name of the chromosome containing the 5' exon (#)
Number of bases from 5' exon
End position of the 5' exon on the chromosome
Chromsome strand of the 5' exon
Name of the chromosome containing the 3' exon (#)
Number of bases from 3' exon
Start position of the 3' exon on the chromosome
Chromsome strand of the 3' exon

Indicate if the splice form is novel
Provide junction sequence if either is_fusion_gene or is_novel_splice_form is true
Type of junction
Count of sequencing reads that span across exons
Quality score for the junction call
Probability of the junction call
